newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares under late selling pressure at close.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares under late selling pressure at close.

text.p: * New Zealand share prices end near lows
* GPG gains, but investment in DB seen as unlikely
* TrustPower rumour resurfaces. Northland gains post result
Price movements at close
LAST CHG
323 +4 * NZSC cap index +8.97 at 4,876.24
368 -2 * Volume NZ$45 million. Futures -6 at 1,173
749 -10 * Other movers - +15 +8
New Zealand share prices came under light selling pressure at the close on Friday after a mixed session on moderate turnover.

The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 11.27 points down at 2,352.13 on turnover worth NZ$45 million. A 10-cent decline in Telecom to NZ$7.49 and a seven cent fall in Fletcher Paper were largely responsible for the decline.
Many of the other major issues were a touch weaker as well, the exception being a four-cent rise in Carter Holt Harvey to NZ$3.23.

Speculation that GPG may be accumulating a stake in liquor company DB Group was losing credence by the close. "I would be surprised if it were true, but obviously that's what has spurred some of the buying," Duncan Rutherford said at ANZ Securities said. GPG declined to comment on the rumour.

GPG ended two cents higher at NZ$0.81 but the rise could have been attributable to a strong market performance by some of GPG's other investments, notably Tyndall. GPG had also benefitted from some favourable broker recommendations.
The TrustPower rumour reared its head again, forcing the utility up 15 to NZ$2.55 on light turnover.
Brokers were taking a wait-and-see approach on whether there would be a merger with Bay of Plenty Electricity.
"But the market still seems to be in limbo," Rutherford said, adding it was likely to remain that way until there was further direction from the current coalition talks.
"Until we get some firmer indications from them I suppose it's going to be a little bit sloppy," Rutherford said. "It's getting close to crunch time one way or another."
Among the minor issues, Northland Port gained eight cents to to NZ$2.58 after reporting strong annual earnings on Thursday, but turnover in the stock was light. -- James Gray 64 9 302 1253
